text:
Since the likelihood functionp(x|θ) is the predictive distribution of the
data given the model parameters, we need to marginalize out the latent
variables so that
p(x|θ) =
∫
p(x|θ,z)p(z)dz, (8.25)
where p(x|z,θ) is given in (8.24) and p(z) is the prior on the latent
variables. Note that the likelihood must not depend on the latent variablesThe likelihood is a
function of the data
and the model
parameters, but is
independent of the
latent variables.
